file_content.text: When my master learned you were here, he demanded I activate the Shock Drum. He'll destroy this entire world.
I know you've located the weapon, but that won't be enough. I changed the deactivation code.
Why not let me find that out the hard way? What are you after, Lord Praven?
You didn't have to tell me.
My master deserves justice, but there are more noble ways to have it. I will destroy you personally.
If you can change it, so can I.
I'll change it back.
Further tampering with the weapon will cause a catastrophic explosion. You need the code I possess.
Lightsabers can deactivate just about anything.
My weapon will do the trick.
The Shock Drum is ray-shielded. Entering the proper code is the only way.
Come. Face me. If I win, I've done my duty. If you win, you'll have the new code.
Whatever the outcome, we will battle with honor. I await you at these coordinates....
Greetings, Jedi. I am Lord Praven.
My master seeks retribution for his son's death. I must give it to him.
If all you want is my death, why destroy Tatooine?
You've endangered innocents.
Get in line, Sith. I have a planet to save.
I don't have time for you.
If you wish to stop this world's destruction, you must face me.
Your fellow Sith on Nar Shaddaa and Alderaan tried to kill me, too. They're dead now.
Easier said than done.
Admirable victories, assuming you achieved them honorably.
Lord Sadic tried to kill me on Nar Shaddaa. He's dead now.
Easier said than done.
An admirable victory, assuming you achieved it honorably.
I'm grateful you saved Tatooine, but Brrik's... my family paid a terrible price. We'd like to be alone.
It's been a great honor. We'll never forget you.
The Shock Drum could split this planet's core any moment--and Brrik is down there! Hurry!
Please, you can't let anything happen to Brrik and his family. Save them and stop the Shock Drum. Hurry!
The Sith changed the deactivation code for the Shock Drum, but I have the new one. I'm on my way.
You're not there yet? Brrik and his family are in terrible danger.
They followed their droids to the mining complex. I tried to stop them, but they were determined to help you.
Brrik just sent an emergency holo. He says there's something called a Sand Demon at the mine. It's attacking them.
Some sort of creature?
Sand Demon?
The Sith hid your superweapon in the mine without this beast interfering. What changed?
It didn't bother the enemy.
I don't know. Maybe the Shock Drum's vibrations enraged it, attracted it there.
That beastly predator is the only thing that hunts krayt dragons--and those are massive. Brrik doesn't stand a chance.
Blasted fools... don't expect to see your little family again.
They'll be killed.
I placed the scanners. Do you have a fix on the Shock Drum?
Collating the scanner readings now... ah! No wonder the sensors couldn't find it....
It's beneath an abandoned mining complex. I'm sending the coordinates and the Shock Drum's deactivation code.
Everything depends on you, now--but we'll be here if you need us.
We're all going to make it. Just hang in there.
I won't let you down.
If I fail, Tatooine gets destroyed. You don't want to be here for that.
No, it's too risky. Evacuate.
All due respect, Master Jedi--if this planet and its people die, I wouldn't be able to live with myself.
Unless you're planning to invade that mining complex, you aren't much use to me.
You aren't much help, either.
Brrik completed repairs to his droids. We'll try to have them meet you there.
I hope we see you again. Hare'en out....
Plant the ultrasonic scanners at the desert locations I've marked. We'll triangulate the Shock Drum's position.
I just detected the Shock Drum's locator beacon. The weapon has been activated.
If we don't shut it down, the device will soon reach critical mass. When it does, Tatooine's core will explode.
"Boom-boom" exploding Brrik's homeworld. This not happening!
Your home will be fine, Brrik. Just tell me where the Shock Drum is.
Don't worry.
Why isn't the Sith deploying the Shock Drum someplace populated, like Coruscant?
Why destroy Tatooine?
Tatooine may not be a Core World, but there are still many innocent lives in danger.
That's why you weren't killed before. The Sith plans to destroy the whole planet.
No wonder the Sith left you.
It doesn't make any sense. Tatooine has no tactical value. The Republic barely knows it exists.
Pinpointing the Shock Drum's exact location from here is impossible. The seismic vibrations disrupt our sensors.
The general region is thousands of square kilometers... we have to narrow it down, somehow.
Maybe ultrasonic scanners finding "boom-boom"?
Brrik, that's brilliant. The ultrasonic scanners. Of course.
Whatever you're talking about, we need to find the Shock Drum fast.
We're running out of time.
If your sensors are useless, what good will scanners be?
Explain what you mean.
Ultrasonic scanners read seismic disruptions in the ground and trace them to their source.
Isn't there a signal you can transmit to deactivate the Shock Drum from here?
Can you just stop the weapon?
You can only stop the weapon by entering the security code--manually.
Ultrasonic scanners placed in a wide pattern will triangulate the Shock Drum's seismic disturbances. They'll reveal its location.
Installing the scanners is extremely dangerous. The desert region is deadly. Ideally, we'd send an army.
Brrik repairing droids! Jedi and Hare'en having army!
Maybe little astromech donating spare parts?
T7 = no spare parts // Jawa tries anything funny = Jawa gets shocked
Brrik doesn't mean you any harm.
Be nice, Teeseven.
I'd listen if I were you. This droid doesn't pull any punches.
Careful, Brrik.
T7 = always ready for a fight
Teach this little scavenger some manners.
Give the Jawa a jolt.
T7 self-defense weapon = activated + charged
Brrik only wanting to help!
Your droids won't be ready soon enough, Brrik. This Jedi is our only hope.
I feel Master Kiwiiks reaching out to me. Something terrible is happening to her.
We'll save her. That's a promise.
Then let's get moving.
At least we know she's still alive.
It's good you still sense her.
She doesn't have long.
The odds we'll find her alive aren't even worth considering.
She's as good as dead.
We already lost Master Orgus. I won't lose her, too.
If you're trying to prepare me for the worst, cut it out.
Take the ultrasonic scanners. Place them at these map coordinates. We'll contact you by holo once we've triangulated the Shock Drum's location. Good luck!
Facility power is back online. I'm afraid that's the only good news I have.
The power generators are scattered around the desert near here. You need to reactivate all of them.
A Jedi! See, Brrik? I told you help would come.
Brrik happy being wrong!
We'd almost given up hope. Thank you for saving our little family.
Glad to help. Do you people work at this facility?
You're alright now.
You're not actually related...?
Family is an odd word choice.
Not all families are bound by genetics. Ours was formed by circumstance.
This is a top secret facility. Do these things have clearance to be here?
What are these creatures?
Authorized by General Var Suthra himself.
Hare'en saving Brrik's clan after we losing home to Sand People. Brrik swearing to repay kindness working on Shock Drum.
Have you come to protect the Shock Drum like Master Kiwiiks?
What happened to her?
She defended us against Imperial soldiers led by a Sith. She fought bravely, but the Sith was stronger.
I take it the Sith killed her, then?
That is sad news.
Kiwiiks was a Jedi Master. This clearly wasn't your average Sith Lord.
He defeated her so easily?
I don't know about "average," but I've never seen anything like him.
When I find him, he'll learn I don't die as easily.
Wait until he meets me.
She isn't dead. At least, not the last time I saw her.
I assumed he was going to kill us all. Instead, he captured Master Kiwiiks alive and ignored us.
Not ignoring! Scary man destroying Brrik's droids. Taking Brrik many hours rebuilding!
The Sith destroyed your droids, but he didn't harm us. He said we were no threat--that we didn't deserve to die.
I've never known a Sith to show mercy.
That is most strange.
It was almost like the idea of killing us insulted him. He wasn't kind, but I certainly wouldn't describe him as cruel.
If he didn't kill you, it's because he has something worse planned.
He was toying with you.
I didn't get the feeling he intended to come back.
The Sith are masters of betrayal. You're obviously working for him. Tell me the truth!
I think you're lying.
I could never lie to a Jedi--or, or anyone. Please, you have to believe me.
The Sith and his soldiers took Master Kiwiiks and the Shock Drum prototype into the desert.
Brrik and I were attempting to restore power to this facility and track them down when the Sand People attacked.
Sand People always wanting facility. Waiting for sign of weakness. Seeing chance after scary man leaving.
The Sand People won't be a problem anymore--but we need to find that weapon. Can you help?
I need to find the Shock Drum.
Why would Sand People want a research base?
Why do they want this place?
Sand People hating everyone not like them. Attacking farms, mining operations, Jawa crawlers--everything.
Perhaps the Sith convinced the Sand People to keep an eye on this place?
Maybe they're working for him?
They attacked us long before the Sith arrived. Until he came along, our automated defenses kept us safe.
This facility can pick up the Shock Drum's locator beacon, but not until we restore power.
The Sith knocked out all our generators during his attack. If you reactivate them, we can find him, Master Kiwiiks and the Shock Drum.
Power generators being in desert. Desert being full of more Sand People. You having good luck out there!
Despite its present condition, this is a secure facility. Do you have clearance to be here?
